intro: Anisopetala calicopis, commonly known as the California anisopetala, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Anisopetala calicopis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
